OUTPUT: ['Counselor - An advisor, particularly in legal matters.', 'Advocate - A person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause.', 'Legal expert - Someone with specialized knowledge advising on law-related issues.', 'Solicitor - An advocate authorized to represent clients in legal matters.', 'Magistrate - A judicial officer that can offer advice and instruction in certain cases.', 'Paralegal - A professional who assists lawyers, providing guidance and advice on a range of issues.', 'Legal consultant - An advisor with specialized knowledge assisting clients with legal matters.', 'Mediator - Someone who facilitates negotiation or reconciliation between parties, often in a legal context.', 'Attorney-at-law - A lawyer authorized to practice law and offer advice on legal matters.', 'Legal advisor - An expert providing advice and guidance regarding laws and regulations.', "Barrister's assistant - Someone who assists a barrister in advising clients.", 'Notary public - A person authorized to administer oaths, attest documents, etc., sometimes offering legal advice within their area of expertise.', 'Legal counselor - An advisor or consultant specializing in law-related issues.', 'Court clerk - While primarily administrative, court clerks may provide guidance on procedural matters.', 'Arbitrator - A neutral third party who helps resolve disputes and can offer advice during the process.', 'Legal consultancy firm - An organization providing expert legal advice to clients.', 'Judicial mentor - A judge or experienced lawyer offering guidance, particularly for up-and-coming lawyers.', 'Court-appointed advisor - A professional appointed by a court to offer advice and guidance on particular cases.', 'Legal educator - An individual who teaches legal principles but may also provide practical advice to students or clients.', 'Legal pundit - Although typically more public, they often have deep knowledge of the law and can advise on various matters.']
